content:
I'm trying to split a string into lines by 

def lines (s : String) : List String :=
  s.splitOn "\n"

unfortunately, VSCode always wants to replace it with ¬ . (Even if I'm not hovering that line; maybe a vim-mode problem?)

Is there a way to force it to not convert that one occurrence?

You can type \\ to get \ (this is also helpful when writing docstrings in LaTeX).
Sorry, \\ isn't the correct \, it's \ instead. Maybe the best solution is \ followed by backspace.
I usually write n first and then go back and put \ in front of it.
What's wrong with \\ @Junyan Xu ? That's what I usually type to get the \ in \n
All of your \'s appear to be \'s. I think you were worried about one being ∖?
Sorry, I confused myself, typing double \ indeed gives single \.
Ah great, way easier than I thought. Thanks!
Philipp has marked this topic as resolved.
